abstract.p: MasterCard International will promote for first time its new so-called electronic wallet service in commercial scheduled to begin running on NBC during Major League Baseball All-Star Game; spot was created by McCann-Erickson Worldwide Advertising (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: MasterCard International will promote for the first time its new so-called electronic wallet service in a commercial scheduled to begin running tonight on NBC during the Major League Baseball All-Star Game.

The spot, created by the New York office of McCann-Erickson Worldwide Advertising, brings to life the idea of shopping online as a man fills a real basket with merchandise in the same way an Internet shopper fills a virtual basket.

MasterCard International will promote for the first time its new so-called electronic wallet service in a commercial scheduled to begin running tonight on NBC during the Major League Baseball All-Star Game.

The spot, created by the New York office of McCann-Erickson Worldwide Advertising, brings to life the idea of shopping online as a man fills a real basket with merchandise in the same way an Internet shopper fills a virtual basket.
In the spot, he is then able to jump ahead of other shoppers waiting in line to make purchases because he has registered for the MasterCard E-Wallet.

The E-Wallet, developed by Brodia in San Francisco, an online shopping services company, enables MasterCard customers to charge purchases at many Web sites but only enter one time their credit card account numbers and addresses.

''Research indicates that many online users abandon the checkout form prior to completing the transaction,'' said Larry Flanagan, the senior vice president for North American marketing at MasterCard in Purchase, N.Y. They do so, he said,''in part due to the redundancy of providing the information each time they make a purchase.''

The spot, which is part of the ''Priceless'' campaign for MasterCard, will be followed by newspaper and magazine ads. McCann-Erickson is part of the McCann-Erickson World Group unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies.
